Package ca.keefer.sanemethod.Environment

Interface Summary
Environment An environment in which entities can exist
Layer Interface for Layers - logically seperate aspects of the display that can be updated and rendered on an individual basis.
 

Class Summary
AbstractEnvironment The common bits of all environments.
BackgroundLayer This class implements Layer, and is responsible for containing any background image, and scrolling it, clamping it, etc., as desired
EntityLayer The EntityLayer class implements the Layer interface, and provides a common layer for entities on the same level to be drawn together.
HudLayer  
MapObject Contains the resources and methods for constructing a new tiledEnvironment from a shapelist and tmx map file, as defined in the loading list
ParticleLayer Particle Layer implements the Layer interface, for the sake of being rendered, updated and translated in time with the other display layers.
TiledEnvironment This class helps bridge the gap between the Phys2D static bodies and the TilEd tmx maps.
TileLayer This class defines a TileLayer, which implements the Layer interface, and stores a reference to the TiledMap from which it is derived, as well as the ViewPort to which it is attached.
ViewPort Controls whats viewable on-screen at any one time - the 'camera' through which the user sees the virtual world.
